Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Class LDAPClientConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connection
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPClientConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, LDAPConnected, LDAPPostTLS, LDAPSession
    public class LDAPClientConnection
extends Connection
implements LDAPConnected, LDAPPostTLS, LDAPSession
    Event-driven, NIO-based LDAP client connection.

    This connection handles the LDAP protocol using BER encoding/decoding and integrates with Gumdrop's asynchronous I/O framework.

    The connection implements stateful interfaces that guide the handler through the LDAP protocol:

    • LDAPConnected - initial state, allows bind and STARTTLS
    • LDAPPostTLS - after STARTTLS, must bind
    • LDAPSession - after bind, full operations available
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

      • bind

        public void bind​(java.lang.String dn,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 BindResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPConnected
        Performs a simple bind (authentication) with DN and password.

        This is the standard authentication method for LDAP. After a successful bind, the handler receives an LDAPSession for performing directory operations.

        Specified by:
        bind in interface LDAPConnected
        Specified by:
        bind in interface LDAPPostTLS
        Parameters:
        dn - the distinguished name to bind as (e.g., "cn=admin,dc=example,dc=com")
        password - the password for authentication
        callback - receives the bind result

      • bindAnonymous

        public void bindAnonymous​(BindResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPConnected
        Performs an anonymous bind.

        Anonymous binds use empty DN and password. Some servers allow limited operations (typically read-only searches) for anonymous connections.

        Specified by:
        bindAnonymous in interface LDAPConnected
        Specified by:
        bindAnonymous in interface LDAPPostTLS
        Parameters:
        callback - receives the bind result

      • startTLS

        public void startTLS​(StartTLSResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPConnected
        Initiates a STARTTLS upgrade to encrypt the connection.

        This should be called before binding to protect credentials. The LDAPClient must have been configured with an SSLContext before connecting.

        After successful TLS upgrade, the handler receives an LDAPPostTLS interface and should proceed to bind.

        Specified by:
        startTLS in interface LDAPConnected
        Parameters:
        callback - receives the STARTTLS result

      • unbind

        public void unbind()
        Description copied from interface: LDAPConnected
        Closes the connection without binding.

        Sends an unbind request and closes the connection. This is appropriate when the handler decides not to proceed with the connection (e.g., TLS not available when required).

        Specified by:
        unbind in interface LDAPConnected
        Specified by:
        unbind in interface LDAPPostTLS
        Specified by:
        unbind in interface LDAPSession

      • search

        public void search​(SearchRequest request,
                   SearchResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPSession
        Performs a search operation.

        Search results are delivered incrementally:

        • SearchResultHandler.handleEntry(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.SearchResultEntry) for each matching entry
        • SearchResultHandler.handleReference(java.lang.String[]) for referrals
        • SearchResultHandler.handleDone(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPResult, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPSession) when search completes
        Specified by:
        search in interface LDAPSession
        Parameters:
        request - the search request parameters
        callback - receives search results

      • modify

        public void modify​(java.lang.String dn,
                   java.util.List<Modification> modifications,
                   ModifyResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPSession
        Modifies an existing entry.

        The modifications map contains attribute names as keys and modification operations as values. Each modification specifies an operation type (add, delete, replace) and values.

        Specified by:
        modify in interface LDAPSession
        Parameters:
        dn - the distinguished name of the entry to modify
        modifications - the modifications to apply
        callback - receives the modify result

      • compare

        public void compare​(java.lang.String dn,
                    java.lang.String attribute,
                    byte[] value,
                    CompareResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPSession
        Compares an attribute value in an entry.

        The result indicates whether the specified attribute in the entry contains the given value:

        • CompareResultHandler.handleCompareTrue(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPSession) if it matches
        • CompareResultHandler.handleCompareFalse(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.LDAPSession) if it doesn't
        Specified by:
        compare in interface LDAPSession
        Parameters:
        dn - the distinguished name of the entry
        attribute - the attribute name to compare
        value - the value to compare against
        callback - receives the compare result

      • extended

        public void extended​(java.lang.String oid,
                     byte[] value,
                     ExtendedResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPSession
        Performs an extended operation.

        Extended operations allow protocol extensions beyond the core LDAP operations. Common examples include password modify and whoami operations.

        Specified by:
        extended in interface LDAPSession
        Parameters:
        oid - the OID identifying the extended operation
        value - the request value (may be null)
        callback - receives the extended operation result

      • rebind

        public void rebind​(java.lang.String dn,
                   java.lang.String password,
                   BindResultHandler callback)
        Description copied from interface: LDAPSession
        Re-binds with different credentials.

        This allows switching to a different user identity within the same connection. On success, a new LDAPSession is provided with the new identity.

        Specified by:
        rebind in interface LDAPSession
        Parameters:
        dn - the distinguished name to bind as
        password - the password for authentication
        callback - receives the bind result
